heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 21 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.1°C) and outside temperature (up 2.2°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3428 lux) and cloud levels (up 298 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 46.2°C), feels like temperature (up 49.8°C), outside temperature (up 48.5°C), and light levels (up 3111 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 298.0m lower than yesterday, 43.7m higher than the past week, 166.6m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 1011m to 4080m and averaged 1894.4m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and bright intervals likely. Weather should be calm and steady.
